body_html: @soumith Thanks for your answer. Am I missing sth. In the simple convnet example using mnist. There's model = Net() so after training to evaluate my model shouldn't I do model.forward(x) or is it as you've said model(x) to evaluate the model? I'm a bit confused here.
body_text: @soumith Thanks for your answer. Am I missing sth. In the simple convnet example using mnist. There's model = Net() so after training to evaluate my model shouldn't I do model.forward(x) or is it as you've said model(x)  to evaluate the model? I'm a bit confused here.
body: @soumith Thanks for your answer. Am I missing sth. In the simple convnet example using mnist. There's `model = Net()` so after training to evaluate my model shouldn't I do `model.forward(x)` or is it as you've said `model(x)`  to evaluate the model? I'm a bit confused here.
